title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to treat certain amounts paid for physical activity, fitness, and exercise as amounts paid for medical care.
content: Personal Health Investment Today Act of 2009 or the PHIT Act of 2009 - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to allow a medical care tax deduction for up to $1,000 of qualified sports and fitness expenses. Defines qualified sports and fitness expenses as amounts paid for fitness center memberships, physical exercise programs, and exercise equipment.
